issue.title: can't install apache arror on windows 10
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4458](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4458). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I receive this error message when importing pyarrow:
Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
 File "D:\Python\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\pyarrow\__init__.py", line 54, in <module>
 from pyarrow.lib import cpu_count, set_cpu_count
ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.

I am using this:

Python 3.7.1 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Nov 13 2018, 19:01:41) [MSC v.1900 64 bit (AMD64)] :: Anaconda, Inc. on win32

I saw that someone else had the same problem here:

<https://github.com/conda-forge/pyarrow-feedstock/issues/54>

but the solution didn't help in my case.

List of packages installed:

(base) C:\Users\marcc>conda list

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4458?focusedCommentId=16759372) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
`[~marcco411]` You have two issues:
 \* `pyarrow` was installed via `pip` (it's listed as pypi)
 \* `libboost` is incompatible with packages from conda-forge.
 \* You can fix this by running
 \*\* `conda uninstall libboost pyarrow`
 \*\* `conda install -c conda-forge pyarrow`

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4458?focusedCommentId=16759570) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Please reopen if you find an new environment incantation for installing everything from conda-forge where things don't work properly

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4458?focusedCommentId=16759606) by Marc Cohen (marcco411):*
I can't do it since whatever I try I get: RemoveError: 'setuptools' is a dependency of conda and cannot be removed from
conda's operating environment.

I guess I ll try reinstalling a new environment

Thanks for the guidance

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4458?focusedCommentId=16759711) by Marc Cohen (marcco411):*
fyi, I think my anaconda install became corrupted. I uninstalled it and reinstalled it. then used
 \* `conda install -c conda-forge pyarrow   and it works well. Thanks again!`
